info.title: Vacasa Connect
info.description:
Welcome to Vacasa Connect!  Connect is a RESTful JSON API interface for Vacasa services.



            ### _How can I use Connect?_

            You will need an HTTP client -- either a library or an application -- to interact with the API.  Consider [Paw](https://paw.cloud/] (for Mac)) (for Mac) or [Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/apps).



            ### _Having Trouble? Check your Content-Type header._

            All requests should include a Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json header.



            ### _How do I give feedback or get support?_

            Please speak to your supervisor or product representative.



            # JSON-API + OpenAPI
This API adheres to the [JSON-API 1.0 spec](http://jsonapi.org/format/).


            Our spec files conform to [OpenAPI 2.0/Swagger specification](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md).  There are many [libraries and clients](https://swagger.io/open-source-integrations/]) available for OpenAPI, which should ease your integration efforts.


            Some conventions are not covered in the JSON-API spec.  See sections below for further convention guides.



            # Authentication
The Connect API supports API token-based authentication.


            Two endpoints are available to assist in managing your authenticated sessions:


                - Create Authenticated Session

                - Refresh Authenticated Session

To begin using Connect, you will need an API Secret and API Key.  Speak to your product representative to obtain your secret and key.



            # Error Responses
Errors follow JSON-API spec: [http://jsonapi.org/format/#errors](http://jsonapi.org/format/#errors)


            Validation errors can be found in the error response JSON body `meta` node. 



            # Filtering

            Filtering follows recommendation defined at [http://jsonapi.org/recommendations/#filtering](http://jsonapi.org/recommendations/#filtering).



            # Localization

                ## Requests

                Localization HTTP headers **MAY** be sent with each request to define the preferred language and country, timezone, or currency of response data.


                The request **MAY** be honored.  If the content cannot be delivered as requested in the localization headers, an error response is returned.


                See Localization Trait for request header definitions.



                ## Responses

                Response content localization is expressed in the following HTTP headers:


                    - `Content-Language`

                    - `X-Timezone`


                Format will follow the same supported format as for the corresponding request headers.



            # Pagination
Pagination follows specification defined at [http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination)


            For example
`?page[number]=1&page[size]=5` will result in returning page 1 with 5 results



            # Sorting

            Sorting follows this recommendation: [http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sorting](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sorting)


            For example `?sort=col1,-col2` will sort results first by `col1` (ascending) then `col2` (descending).



            # Sparse Fieldsets

            Sparse fieldsets are supported on non-authentication endpoints.  [http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sparse-fieldsets](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sparse-fieldsets)


                ## Example
`?fields[Reservation]=reservation_id,channel` will retrieve only the `reservation_id` and `channel` properties of `Reservation` resource objects.


                Sparse fieldsets may also be applied to included resource objects.


                Only top-level object resource attributes can be specified.

post.description:
Create a refreshable auth session.  Used the returned data to build your subsequent requests.

### Signature generation:

Signature is a HMAC-SHA256 hash of `api_key.timestamp.api_secret` (in hex)

- **api_key**: your api key
- **timestamp**: epoch timestamp(aka unix time), for example 1507584555
- **api_secret**: your api secret

### PHP Example:
```
$timestamp = time();
$correct_signature = hash_hmac('sha256', $api_key.$timestamp.$api_secret, $api_secret);
```

get.description:
Fetches a list of availability data.


                    **NOTE:** This endpoint maintains a rolling 30-day window of eligibility unless date filters are explicitly set otherwise.

parameters.name: filter[updated_at_min]
parameters.description: Retrieve availability where the last updated time is greater than the given value.

parameters.name: filter[unit_id]
parameters.description: Filters results by provided unit id.

parameters.name: filter[date]
parameters.description: filters results for exact match of date attribute

parameters.name: filter[date_min]
parameters.description: filters results for date attribute equal to or greater than date_min. If not specified, it defaults to the current date.

parameters.name: filter[date_max]
parameters.description: filters results by date attribute equal to or less than date_max. If not specified, it defaults to 30 days from the current date.
This header is deprecated. Please discontinue use of this header.
parameters.name: X-Monocache
filter[available]
parameters.description:
True if the following conditions are met:
1. There are no conflicting reservations
2. There is a non-zero rate

parameters.name: filter[active]
parameters.description: Valid values are 1 and 0.

parameters.name: filter[is_blocked_or_warned]
parameters.description: Valid values are 1 and 0.

parameters.name: filter[phone]
parameters.description: Returns blocked users with a partial or full  match for `phone`. Valid values are digits 0-9, non-digit characters are not allowed. Full matches for `phone` are very explicit. For example, if there is no country code provided in the input, the results may include records with country codes e.g. `filter[phone]= 5031231234` will match `+1 (503) 123-1234`, `1-503-123-1234`, `15031231234` and `5031231234`. Likewise, filter input of a full phone number including a country code will only return records of an exact match. i.e. `filter[phone]=15031231234` will only match `+1 (503) 123-1234`, `1-503-123-1234`, and `15031231234`, but not `5031231234`. Partial matches are found in a sequential manner, i.e. `503123` will match `503-123-1234`, but not `503-456-1234`

post.description: Creates a Contact and also creates a Login if one doesn't exist.

phone_notes.description: Corresponds to Phone Notes on Contact page in Admin, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/tools/rm/owners?ContactID=20557](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/tools/rm/owners?ContactID=20557).

send_email.description: Passing `true` will cause an "Owner Welcome" email to be sent to the Contact's email address.

get.description: Retrieve a single contact by its primary identifier.

email.description: A "Vacasa Login Change" email will be sent if this differs from the existing contact.

language_id.description: A language_id for a valid language.

send_email.description: Passing `true` will cause an "Owner Welcome" email to be sent to the Contact's email address.

patch.description: Updates the financial information for a given contact.

get.description: This endpoint requires an API key with Sensitive Data authorization permissions.

parameters.name: filter[active_only]
parameters.description: Return only active units.  True by default.

post.description: Create a contract.  Links a contract to a contact.  This endpoint will create an owner with percentage ownership and tax ownership.

amendment_by_notice_id.description: Foreign key to table contract_amendment_by_notice, corresponds to Amendment by Notice on Contract page in Admin, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085).

channel_fee_cost_sharing_id.description: Foreign key to table contract_channel_fee_cost_sharing, corresponds to Channel Fee Cost Sharing on Contract page in Admin, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085).

created_by.description: A valid Login ID.  Foreign key to logins.UserID.

end_date.description: Format is `YYYY-MM-DD`. start_date and end_date must not overlap existing contracts associated with the given unit_id.

form_id.description: Foreign key to table contract_form, corresponds to Contract Form on Contract page in Admin, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085).

management_fee.description: management_fee must be <= 1.  management_fee minus referral_discount MUST be >= 0

monthly_rent.description: Corresponds to Fixed Monthly Rent on Contract page in Admin, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085).

percentage_ownership.description: Sum of all percentage_ownership values must equal 1.

tax_ownership.description: Sum of all tax_ownership values must equal 1.

referral_discount.description: referral_discount MUST be 0 if referral_eligible is false.  management_fee minus referral_discount MUST be >= 0. Corresponds to Owner Referral Discount on Contract page in Admin, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085)

referral_eligible.description: Corresponds to Owner Referral Eligible on Contract page in Admin, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085).

start_date.description: Format is `YYYY-MM-DD`. start_date and end_date must not overlap existing contracts associated with the given unit_id.

template_version_id.description: Foreign key to table contract_template_version, corresponds to Template Version on Contract page in Admin, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/finance/contract/edit?ContractID=36085).

secured_by.description: A valid Login ID for the user that secured the contract. Foreign key to logins.UserID.

end_date.description: Format is `YYYY-MM-DD`. start_date and end_date must not overlap existing contracts associated with the given unit_id.

post.summary: Create an "abandoned" reservation - used when a guest abandons their cart.

booked_currency_code.description: Any valid, 3 character ISO-4217 currency code. This is the currency which the reservation is transacted in.

cancellation_date.default: The current time of the request
cancellation_date.description:
The cancellation date of the reservation. Must be in the following iso8601-like format
**(YYYY-mm-dd(T)HH:ii:ss(Z OR +-HH:ii)**

created_by.description: User ID from logins.UserID that gets written to Reservations.CreateBy. For non-zero values, this is the Acquisition Rep's UserID (you can see your UserID on the org chart - https://www.vacasarentals.com/admin/orgchart.php)

creation_date.default: The current time of the request, or the provided value of cancellation date
creation_date.description:
The creation date of the reservation. Must be in the following iso8601-like format
**(YYYY-mm-dd(T)HH:ii:ss(Z OR +-HH:ii)**

display_currency_code.description: Any valid, 3 character ISO-4217 currency code. This is the currency which is preferred by the guest for display purposes.

source.description: A Vacasa-issued code identifying the source of this request. Validated against reservations_sources.external_source_name

post.description: Requests to this endpoint can be made with either a V2 quote id or granular details for stay and finances. If both are supplied, quote id data will be used. Only the following data from the V2 quote is used for reservation creation: unit_id, arrival, departure, adult, children, pets, discount_id, and trip_protection.

parameters.name: filter[phone]
parameters.description: Reservations with a partial or full  match for `phone`. Valid values are digits 0-9, non-digit characters are not allowed. Full matches for `phone` are very explicit. For example, if there is no country code provided in the input, the results may include records with country codes e.g. `filter[phone]= 5031231234` will match `+1 (503) 123-1234`, `1-503-123-1234`, `15031231234` and `5031231234`. Likewise, filter input of a full phone number including a country code will only return records of an exact match. i.e. `filter[phone]=15031231234` will only match `+1 (503) 123-1234`, `1-503-123-1234`, and `15031231234`, but not `5031231234`. Partial matches are found in a sequential manner, i.e. `503123` will match `503-123-1234`, but not `503-456-1234`

parameters.name: filter[fee_amount_min]
parameters.description: Reservations with fees that are greater than this value

parameters.name: filter[cancelled_reservation]
parameters.description: 1 for cancelled, 0 for non-cancelled.

parameters.name: filter[paid]
parameters.description: Reservations with paid that are equal than this value.

parameters.name: filter[reservation_types]
parameters.description: Reservations matching the type(s). More than one may be included if seperated by a `,`. Valid types are 1 for reservation, 2 for Owner hold and 3 for Vacasa Hold

get.description:
Retrieve a list of photos for a given unit.

The photos are sorted by image_rank in ascending order.
Retrieve a single unit by its primary identifier.

parameters.name: include_meta
parameters.description:
Request additional custom attributes be returned in 'meta' object on the Unit resource.

Supported value: 'photos_list' (returns array of photo URLs is default ASC order)

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of resources to include.

active.description:
The active status of the unit.
                                                    
`0` => `Inactive`
                                                    
`1` => `Active` (May not be active until the unit has an associated accounting entity)
                                                    
`2` => `Maintenance`

created_by.description: The `logins.UserID` of whomever created the Unit. Max length of 10 characters.

display.description: Whether or not to display the unit. AKA 'copy ready'. May not be true until the unit has an associated accounting entity.

finance_reporting_location_code.description: The finance_reporting_location.code active for the unit

local_operations_manager.description: The `logins.UserID` of the local operations manager.

regional_director.description: The `logins.UserID` of the regional operations director.

vacasa_contact_id.description: ID of the Vacasa Contact. Must be an integer, a valid `logins.ID` and cannot exceed 10 digits.

AmenityName.description: Any valid AmenityName from the `amenities` table will work here, as well as an integer to populate the `amenity_value` field

patch.description: Update certain Attributes, or any Amenity/Feature of a Unit

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of units.

parameters.name: filter[active]
parameters.description: `0`: Inactive `1`: Active `2`: Maintenance Only

parameters.name: filter[terminated]
parameters.description: `0`: Not Terminated `-1`: Termination Pending `1`: Terminated

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number of paginated results

parameters.name: page[limit]
parameters.description: Number of entries per page in paginated results

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort by one or more attributes.  Separate attributes with commas.  They will be sorted in the order set in the value.  Default ordering is ascending.  To add descending ordering, prepend attribute name with `-`.

See [http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sorting](http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sorting) for examples.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma separated list of related resources to include.

parameters.name: include_meta
parameters.description:
Request additional custom attributes be returned in 'meta' object on each Unit resource via a comma separated list

Supported values:
 'photos_list' (returns array of photo URLs is default ASC order)
'amenities_map' (returns json object of key:value amenities map)

parameters.name: filter[amenities]
parameters.description:
key/value array to filter units by available amenities. multiple amenities can be provided.

If a value is not provided, it will default to a value of 1

ex: filter[amenities][internet]=1

parameters.name: filter[occupancy_min]
parameters.description:
Filter units by 'max_occupancy'. Returns units where 'max_occupancy' >= filter value.

Also provide filters for 'adults_min' and 'children_min' to filter more precisely for units meeting all three criteria. The value of filter[occupancy_min] should be equal to filter[adults_min] + filter[children_min].

Ex.: filter[adults_min]=10&filter[children_min]=2&filter[occupancy_min]=12

parameters.name: filter[adults_min]
parameters.description: Filter units by 'max_adults'. Returns units where 'max_adults' >= filter value

parameters.name: filter[children_min]
parameters.description: Filter units by 'max_children'. Returns units where 'max_children' >= filter value

parameters.name: filter[geo_bounds]
parameters.description:
## Define either a bounding box or a bounding circle within which to find units.

**IMPORTANT:**
`[box]` and `[circle]` parameters cannot be used together. Please choose one or the other.

`filter[geo_bounds][box]` (`string`)

* Define the latitude/longitude coordinates of the southwest and northeast corners of a bounding box within which to find units.
* Separate the coordinate sets with a pipe (|), like so: `swLat,swLng|neLat,neLng`

_Example:_
`filter[geo_bounds][box]=24.586431285153,-81.607737391021|24.760098714847,-81.416621608979`

---

`filter[geo_bounds][circle]` (`array` containing two or three `string` items)

* Define the center point and radius of a bounding circle within which to find units.
* Provide the latitude/longitude coordinates for the center point as comma-separated values with the key `[center_point]`, and the radius with the key `[radius]`. The default unit of measurement for the radius value is kilometers, but you may specify miles instead by providing the key `[unit_measurement]` with a value of `mi`.
* `[center_point]` and`[radius]` are **required**, while `[unit_measurement]` is **optional**.

_Example:_
`filter[geo_bounds][circle][center_point]=24.673265,-81.5121795&filter[geo_bounds][circle][radius]=5&filter[geo_bounds][circle][unit_measurement]=mi`

parameters.name: filter[check_in_date]
parameters.description: Filter units by availability. Required if filter[check_out_date] is provided

parameters.name: filter[check_out_date]
parameters.description: Filter units by availability. Required if filter[check_in_date] is provided

parameters.name: filter[updated_at_min]
parameters.description: An ISO-8601 date.  Units returned will have an `updated_at` property of this date-time or greater.

parameters.name: filter[unit_id]
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of unit IDs

parameters.name: filter[country]
parameters.description:
Filter units by ISO-3166-1 Alpha-2 country code

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2

example: US

acquisition_id.description: A valid primary key for an acquisition.

city.description: The value of this field influence the values of other location fields for a Unit (`CityID`, `RegionID`, `CountryID/Code`), so while this field may be populated with a valid `City`, it must also be valid in relation to `address.state` (i.e. Where there is the given `city`, there is an associated `state`)

state.description: The value of this field influence the values of other location fields for a Unit (`StateID`, `RegionID`, `CountryID/Code`), so while this field may be populated with a valid `State`, it must also be valid in relation to `address.city` (i.e. Where there is the given `state`, there is an associated `city`)

amenity_email.description: Selected from hardcoded list of email addresses in Admin source code, corresponds to Send Amenity Request Email to on Listing tab for a unit, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/units/listing?UnitID=21967](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/units/listing?UnitID=21967).

code.description: Unit code, alternate unique identifier for a unit, e.g. NYFI16-OBV for [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/units/edit?UnitID=2196](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/units/edit?UnitID=2196).

created_by.description: The `logins.UserID` of whomever created the Unit. Max length of 10 characters.

housing_type.description: Effective foreign key to table Codes with CodeTypeId = 2, corresponds to Housing Type on Listing tab for a unit, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/units/listing?UnitID=21967](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/units/listing?UnitID=21967)

local_operations_manager.description: The `logins.UserID` of the local operations manager.

m_source.description: Effective foreign key to table Codes with CodeTypeId = 3, corresponds to Source on Listing tab for a unit, e.g., [https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/units/listing?UnitID=21967](https://www.vacasa.com/admin/dashboard/units/listing?UnitID=21967).

regional_director.description: The `logins.UserID` of the regional operations director.

secured_by.description: The UserID of whomever secured this unit.

vacasa_contact_id.description: ID of the Vacasa Contact. Must be an integer, a valid `logins.ID` and cannot exceed 10 digits.

AmenityName.description: Any valid AmenityName from the `amenities` table will work here, as well as an integer to populate the `amenity_value` field

See [TZ Database Time Zones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) on Wikipedia.  Examples: `America/Aruba` `America/Argentina/San_Juan`
